solution_line_template: Start by finding the total that is left, ${car_price} car price - ${car_wash_earnings} earned at car wash = $<<{car_price}-{car_wash_earnings}={remaining_cost}>>{remaining_cost} remaining.

So the {initial_friends_count} friends should pay ${remaining_cost} / {initial_friends_count} people = $<<{remaining_cost}/{initial_friends_count}={initial_share_per_friend}>>{initial_share_per_friend} each.

Since Brad is not joining, then the {remaining_friends_count} friends have to split Brad's share which is ${initial_share_per_friend}/{remaining_friends_count} = $<<{initial_share_per_friend}/{remaining_friends_count}={additional_cost_per_friend}>>{additional_cost_per_friend} each.
